Profile.nme: Cancel Google Search Listen With Tasker
If Intercepting Google Search Send It To Tasker

Share.d:
Intercept Google searches started with Hey Google and send the search command into Tasker so you can do what you want with it.

You can essentially replace Google Assistant but keep the no-hands functionality!

How It Works

  • When you import the project you can select if you want to use a keyword or not
    • If you use a keyword, only commands starting with that keyword will be sent to Tasker
    • If you don't use a keyword, all commands will be sent to Tasker and you'll stop Google.
  • After a Google command is recognized, it'll be set to the %LastGoogleSearch variable. You can use this variable in your profiles or tasks.

Example Profile

  • Create a new profile with the Event > Variable Set condition
  • Use the %LastGoogleSearch variable in the condition and don't set a value for it to trigger
  • In the task use the Say action and set the text to Searched for %LastGoogleSearch
  • Back out of Tasker all the way to save

Check out the example profile in this project to see a similar example

Now when you do any "Hey Google" command, it'll be cancelled and Tasker will say the command out loud!

Of course, you can do anything you want with this, so get creative!

For example, you could totally replace Google Assistant with ChatGPT with this! üòÅ

Action.Str:
For Tasker to be able to detect when you say "Hey Google", Tasker's accessibility service needs to be enabled.
Without this this project may not work.

To use the Hey Google search commands in Tasker create a new profile with the
Event > Variable Set condition
and use the
\%LastGoogleSearch
variable there.
That variable will always contain the last search command you performed.
In the task you can do anything you want with the variable.

Found the command element!

%command_element_id

You can now say commands on Google Assistant and they will be sent to Tasker!

Action.Str:
Tasker will only intercept your Hey Google commands if they start with a certain keyword.
The keyword can be anything you want like "Tasker" for example.

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Ok.
Only if your commands start with "%input" will they be sent to Tasker.
%search_variable_explanation

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%input Input The text that was inserted in the dialog</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

<StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str: You have to set a keyword.

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Do you want Tasker to intercept your Hey Google before or after you say your command?

If before, you'll say your voice command to Tasker itself and never even talk to Google. It has the disadvantage of you having to do a small pause between saying Hey Google and actually saying your command.

If after, you can say your command right after Hey Google but sometimes Google will start responding before Tasker taking over.
Cancel Google Search Listen With Tasker
If Intercepting Google Search Send It To Tasker

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Ok.
Tasker will take over every time you say "Hey Google" and will start its own voice recognition.
You will then say your commands to Tasker itself and Google will not receive them.
%search_variable_explanation
Cancel Google Search Listen With Tasker
If Intercepting Google Search Send It To Tasker

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Ok.
Tasker will take over every time you say "Hey Google" and then say a voice command to Google.
After the command is recognized Tasker will take over and Google Assistant will be cancelled.
However, if you want to run a certain command with the Google Assistant, just say "Hey Google Assistant" (instead of just "Hey Google") followed by your command and Tasker will ignore it.
%search_variable_explanation
